title: So riot will nerf supports and junglers first but not adcs ?
body:
This is really sad. Going around the problem, not straight to it. Everyone gonna get nerfed, but hey don't nerf adcs. The main cause of this problem. Jungler camping bot cuz adc dmg is insane, supps protecting adcs cuz adc dmg is insane = nerf junglers and supps. hmmmmmm. Nerfing them won't make me not take 600 dmg per crit.
Even when they nerf them somewhat, they get buffed immediately next patch or compensation buff in the same patch. Like holy shit. Imagine some other role having a 30% pick rate champ with over 50% win rate. Would get gutted. But nahh, adcs gotta get that immediate compensation. God forbid tristana doesn't get in every game.

Yep. I'm not asking anyone to pretend to not be frustrated. If you're frustrated, please keep telling us! It's important for us to know these things.

ADCs need adjustments, I agree. We're discussing the extent to which we may change things. We've talked changing their power curves, their base stats and stat growth, their item paths, their top end dps, individual problematic items, etc. We haven't settled on any particular direction, and so all I can talk is hopeful timeline at the moment.

And again, if that doesn't cut it, please continue to voice that in a way that is demonstrative of how you think the game ought to be change. There are tons of opinions out there as to the direction we ought to take the game on basically any topic we could choose, so keep those opinions coming. It's appreciated.

Randomly rambling from a tired Djinn. Advanced warning.

Initial thought if tasked to come up with thoughts (on the spot) is that an entire class of characters designed to scale heavily into the late-game is almost at odds with Riot's ideal game length, which tends to be just short enough that many of these characters have to come online early enough that it begins to feel problematic in longer games. Either they come on too early, or their potential late-game power has to sacrifice enough early power that they're super risky to have in a team (not ideal, given how important they are to current objective-taking), or they have a powerful enough early game that it makes their powerful late game too accessible.

It sort of makes me wonder about designs you could take to flatten ADC growth past an an initial 20-25 minute "spike" so that they come online as major powerhouses around a certain time but cease to become a non-linear-scaling menace in a game of linear scalering as the game progresses: perhaps gaining additional defenses or tank-busting capabilities rather than simply increasing their overall power against every member of the cast. The problem is that most ways I can think of to do that either suffer clarify-wise, make itemization less satisfying, or reverberate down the rest of the cast significantly.

Additionally, any solution like that would involve killing off most of the hypercarries, but you could then emphasize that identity on one or two by unlocking their scaling in much the same way that Veigar/Nasus do -- Tristana and Kog'Maw seem good candidates for that, given their history. Might be a benefit to be able to put back some of those delineations.

Sorry, just sort of throwing out thoughts as they occur. Not really sure of this myself, but it was interesting to write up. :)

I can't help but feel ADCs need to pull away from 90% of their damage being based auto attack critting and more about needing to use their kits. So long as the ADC is a walking stat stick there will always be 1~3 "best" ADCS. They need to be individualized via their kits.

I think Ashe is a good example with how her Crit hits increase the power of her slows. She's rewarded for building crit, but in a way that expresses her kit.

Quinn is another good example. I think her passive could be reworked to: Scale off AD, have the ability to critically strike with her attack, and CD faster depending on how much attack speed she has. This rewards her for proper management of her minigame.

Speaking of minigame, how about that MF Q crit? It takes skill to pull off, but feels immensely satisfying to land a juicy Q crit on an enemy champ. Furthermore Riot could increase the Crit ratio on her Ult from 20/30% to 50/75% to let her scale into the late game that way as well.

Oh, and armor penetration needs to go die in a fire. It has never been a healthy mechanic and never will be. This can be seen with how it has been reworked not once, not twice, but THREE TIMES by now. You want assassins to burst squishy targets? Give them better AD ratios on their abilities. You want to increase their damage to champions specifically to keep wave clear in check? Make it so that Lethality instead reads: "Deals +10% more damage to champions".

Especially given with how well Armor Pen. synergies with the ADC item Last Whisper. What's the counter to Lethality? Building Armor. What's the counter to Armor? Last Whisper. What's the counter to Leathality+Last Whisper? Exploding them before they can explode you. Does no one else see this as a problem?

I actually thought of a fairly basic thing that covers the way to fix ADCs, and open up a rework of mage itemization to make tank busting a choice to opt into in the same step.  Rework crit.  Instead of crit being "double damage(or x2.5 damage)" rework it to just penetrate resistances.  Lets say 75%.  It applies to all damage dealt, not just auto attacks.  IE, and a complementary "mage" IE increases the pen to 100% resist pen.

Now you may say "But this breaks mages!"  Put crit itemization that a mage could access to have low/no AP.   For example, Liandry's Torment would be 30 AP 20% crit.  Main thing being that if you opt into heavy crit on a mage, you will definitely suffer on squishy killing from low AP values of having 3+ items have fairly low AP, but you'd get to cut through tanks better.


Compared to current crit, this is a nerf on targets with 125 armor or so, and increase that to 150ish with IE taken into account, but it does make it FAR better on someone stacking resist.

Boom, now ADC (and crit mages) are showing a dedication to tank busting at the exception of squishy busting.  This also opens up certain aspects of currently ADC exclusive itemization to be attractive on mages that may quite enjoy the mechanics, such as Rapidfire Cannon for Twisted Fate or Shiv for a low waveclear mage.


Crit becomes less snowbally (an early crit in lane won't massively spike damage, only minorly boost it), makes crit attractive as a stat on many different types of champions, and helps deshackle ADC away from "Omni-burst" to "Good at killing tanks/objectives, but not bursting the rest of the team with the DPS required to kill a tank."

Repertoir, I believe it's unhealthy for the game to have ADCs to be the tank buster role. 

This job fits way better with Bruisers and Juggernaughts, having your squishy carry be the one with most DPS and the tank killer makes it impossible to balance. Please just think about it, discuss this internally, is all I'm asking. 

Adcs are suppose to have constant dps, but to destroy tanks they need so much steroids and items that they just burst everything that don't have 3k HP with +200AR. 

I really believe if you shift the job of dealing with tanks to bruisers and make more items like {{item:3036}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3153}} but tailored for bruisers instead of ADCs, you and your team will have a easier time balancing the game and how much damage ADCs can deal.
So what do ADCs do?
The main source of constant DPS? Suitable to take objectives and towers? Do you need to be that and the tank killer?
How satisfying would it be to play as 'the guy that takes towers'? League is a PvP game, and declaring that ADCs should only be focused on PvE objectives runs counter to that.

To be fair I think ADC's need to return to being a niche to the team rather than the mandatory staple. What I mean to say is that work needs to be done so that ADC's fulfill their niches like they used to: Caitlyn in poke comps, Sivir in a Blitzkrieg comp, MF in a super Wombo-Combo team, etc.

Everyone including LCS casters who kiss Riot's paychecks complained about Zoe and her damage, as well as the RNG bullshit. Yet, you guys did nothing for 4+ months... 4 damn months? 

Come on, man.  This "Balance" process is a complete joke, and you know it!

I'm sure everyone whose been paying attention is appreciative of the fact that you guys have confirmed that work will be done on the ADC class in midseason. However, it's incredibly frustrating to hear that such work will not come until midseason, even moreso that nothing specific about said work has been confirmed. The community has already come to a rough consensus of what's wrong with ADCs, primarily that their damage is simply too high, especially in burst, and that their items are either too cheap or too effective. And to a lot of people in the community, it seems like it would be an incredibly easy task to nerf ADCs in those areas. It's no surprise that people are frustrated that we will have to wait several patches for (potential) changes to ADC damage when Riot hasn't even acknowledged that ADC damage is a problem.
